them off and set how uh what cycle increment you would like to refresh that data on so that was a huge win in terms
of making data even more available to the end user um users could now go in

of benefit um by doing the transform at the end um and so we ended up going with

uh SE that you are writing as an analytics team um and reference as
either views or CTE other SQL files in that same project so without getting too

postgress production databases through Stitch and denormalize all of that data

the sort of um compute stress that happens if you run that query directly through looker um this also was super
valuable because they do things like incrementally update these wide tables and manage the dependency graph between
all of these tables um and they do this all in a in a nice um manageable way
that you can very easily deploy to a ec2 tiny uh uh box through it ws and um and

because of the way um red Shift Works it's it's really fast to do table scans

materialized that as a table and then um and then basically pointed looker at
